title: MTS Management Group's Canadian Singer Songwriter Billy Grima to Appear on CHCH TV's "Morning Live" This Monday
text:
MTS Management Group's Canadian Singer Songwriter Billy Grima to Appear on CHCH TV's "Morning Live" This Monday
MTS Management Group's Billy Grima will perform on CHCH TV's "Morning Live" this Monday, September 7th at 8:45am ET.
Ontario, Canada, September 06, 2015 --( PR.com )-- MTS Management Group is happy to announce award-winning pop/rock/americana singer-songwriter, Billy Grima will guest on CHCH TV’s “Morning Live.” Billy is scheduled for Monday, September 7th, 2015 at 8:45 am ET. Billy will be interviewed, and he will perform, promoting his latest single release,”Pleasure To Have Met You,” from his critically acclaimed third album, Sugar & Cream. The show broadcasts live from Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.
For over a decade, southern Ontario has been waking up to one of the most popular morning shows in the country. Bob Cowan and Annette Hamm deliver up-to-the-minute news, business, health, showbiz and interviews, along with some fun. Weather specialist Brian Wood tracks the forecast with state-of-the-art technology. Jaclyn Colville keeps tabs on traffic through an array of more than 200 live cameras, from the GTA to the U.S. border. Lori DeAngelis serves up high-energy and big personality as she visits the people and places that make southern Ontario unique. Tim Bolen delivers your sports highlights, and Lesley Stewart visits the set regularly filling in where she can. Join the Morning Live crew weekday mornings from 6 to 10 to get the information you need to start your day right!
Billy Grima is an award-nominated singer/ songwriter living in the Caledon Hills of Ontario, Canada. Born in Blacktown, NSW Australia, Billy started writing at a very young age and was singing in a church choir by the age of 8 years old. At 15, Billy moved to Canada and settled in Toronto. Like many classic singer/songwriters, life’s daily realities and everyday events are a source of Billy’s inspiration. His smooth and soulful sound has earned him comparisons to many of today’s hottest contemporaries. Billy has 3 albums to his credit: I’m Just Standing, A Little Piece Of Heaven and his latest, titled Sugar & Cream, produced and engineered by Pete Swann (Glass Tiger’s Alan Connely, Adrian and Justin Lifeson, sons of Rush’s Alex Lifeson.) The album received airplay on more than 100 AM/FM stations across North America and more than 500 stations around the world. Billy is a Josie Show Awards nominee, an Akademia Awards Winner, and a three-time 2015 International Music and Entertainment (IMEA) Award nominee.
